instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: Mac pro 13 inch early 2011 keeps rebooting
threads.message: Hi guys i have a macbook pro early 2011 that keeps rebooting. It has been repaired before as I resoldered the legs of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7513</CAPACITOR> has been resoldered. Board looks pretty OK though. Now it can run both ASD test EFI and OS and passes without issue, it also never reboots. Trying to boot any OS version from an external drive, it reboots, shows Apple logo and restarts after a few seconds. Same when I try to run Linux from a USB drive. Anything I should check here? I do have a green and orange light on the charger.

threads.title: Mac pro 13 inch early 2011 keeps rebooting
threads.message:
Did you test one RAM module at a time, each slot by separate?
Also try new BIOS, with clean ME.
